result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus J. Katsma

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Marcus J. Katsma
Current: N7471 Green Drive, Pardeeville, WI 53954 United States  (Effective: 04-27-2016)
Prior: N1163 18th Road, Dalton, WI 53926 United States

Defendant Marcus J. Katsma in court with attorney Jay Englund. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF407 and 15CF83

11:01 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
State files Amended Information in 14CF407. 
Prosecutor states amendments.

Defendant received copy of the Amended Information in 14CF407 and waives its reading.

15CF83:
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
 
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered in 15CF83 only.

Prosecutor states the plea agreement. 
Atty Englund concurs with agreement as stated but with corrections as stated. 
Defendant concurs with agreement. 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF407 Count 1 - GUILTY
14CF407 Count 2 - GUILTY

Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

Atty Molepske notes correction to Columbia County case number in the complaint. 
Court questions Atty Englund. 
Court makes the change on the complaint. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 14CF407 Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CF83 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Englund makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
14CF407 Count 1 -
Pay fine of $100 plus costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Serve 4 days jail with huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date. 
Court does not allow Electronic Monitor. 
Court will allow to serve in Marquette County if that can be arranged. 

14CF407 Count 2 - 
Pay costs.

Bond in 15CF83 is to be applied to the fine/costs.  Balance to be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan and comply with that plan.

ADDRESS INFO for Marcus J. Katsma
Current: N1163 18th Road, Dalton, WI 53926 United States  (Effective: 05-12-2015)
Prior: N7471 Green Dr, Pardeeville, WI 53954

Preliminary hearing at 05-26-2015 08:30 am.
Arraignment at 05-26-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus J. Katsma in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
Defendant will be hiring atty Jay Englund.  Is representing him in other matters. 
Court questions defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Arraignment scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bond $500 - comply with all set forth in bond conditions in 14CF407.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  on scheduled court dates.

DA #15PT432
1:21 p.m. case is called.
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a cash bond $500 - comply with all bond conditions in 14CF407.
Defendant makes statement

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 3-16-15 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3

BTC:  
Cash bond $500 - comply with all set forth in bond conditions in 14CF407
